title: The Writer's Almanac - Wednesday, January 1, 2020
description: The first time that New Year's Day was celebrated on January 1st was in 45 B.C., when Caesar redid the Roman calendar (it later had to be corrected in the 1570s).
itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
itunes:subtitle: The first time that New Year's Day was celebrated on January 1st was in 45 B.C., when Caesar redid the Roman calendar (it later had to be corrected in the 1570s).
